org.orgName: United States District Court, For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of LEWIS JOHNSON, for a WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
3077 No. PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
TO THE HONORABLE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION:

Your petitioner, Lewis Johnson, respectively represents and shows to this Honorable Court that he is a citizen of the United States and a resident of the City of Seattle, King County, State of Washington.

That at the present time, and since the day of June, A.D.1915, he is, and has been wrongfully and unlawfully detained and imprisoned in the County jail of King County, Washington, by John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division:

That according to your petitioner's information and belief the cause of his detention is that on or about the day of June, A.D.1915, a complaint was filed before the Honorable John C. Whitlock, United States Commissioner for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, whereby your petitioner was charged with the crime of theft, alleged to have been committed in the Dominion of Canada, which said charge was without probable cause, and is and was untrue; and, that thereafter, the said John C. Whit- lock, United States Commissioner aforesaid, ordered and directed that said petitioner be held to answer said charge, and held and de- tained, subject to the order of the authorities of the Dominion of Canada, a Province of Great Britain, and to be deported thereto
to answer said charge so wrongfully and illegally made, which said order and proceedings and all matters connected therewith are irre- gular, illegal, and void.

Petitioner further shows to this Honorable Court that the hearing before said Commissioner, John C. Whitlock, was without authority; that the same was irregular and illegal; that no legal evidence of any kind whatever was presented or submitted to the said Commissioner, John C. Whitlock, upon which the sald Commissioner could have based his order for the arrest and detention of said petitioner, and that there was no probable cause for the filing of said information, or the making of said order.

WHEREFORE, to be relieved of said unlawful detention and imprisonment, your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus, to be directed to the said John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division,aroresaid, may issue in this behalf, so that your petitioner may be forthwith brought before this Honorable Court to submit to and receive what the law may direct, and that an order may issue herein directed to the said John C. Whitlock, United States Commissioner, aforesaid, directing the said John C. Whitlock, aforesaid, to certify to this Court a true copy of all proceedings had and done before the said John C. Whitlock, in connection with the arrest and imprisonment of your petitioner herein, together with all papers, exhibits and other records in con- nection with said matter.
